channel.title: I KNOW WHAT THE PROBLEM IS I NEED HELP(seriously need help)
channel.description: Well, i've been folowing this guide i got from google on how to install ubuntu onto an external drive, it works very well. but right when you finish installing and it asks you to reboot, it says to put back in the CD and in ubuntu select "rescue system", i found something similar to it but it didn't help, somebody please help.

item.title: I KNOW WHAT THE PROBLEM IS I NEED HELP(seriously need help)
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

someones fucked his 500gb external hdd up :o

Read full topic

item.title: I KNOW WHAT THE PROBLEM IS I NEED HELP(seriously need help)
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

[quote=“darkdemun”]was the error something like this? Grub Error 18: Exceeds Bios

and please tell me what you did during the installation. and are in in ubuntu right now?[/quote]
if the bootloader is screwed, no he is not.

Read full topic

item.title: I KNOW WHAT THE PROBLEM IS I NEED HELP(seriously need help)
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

[quote=“darkdemun”]we can’t do shit without the exact error, im thinking the grub boot loader isn’t detecting your windows install because you fucked it when you installed ubuntu[/quote]your probably right, what do i do? and i think it is Grub error 18

item.title: I KNOW WHAT THE PROBLEM IS I NEED HELP(seriously need help)
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

hmm did you try and install it onto your hard drive? or your external hard drive… since it tried to go to windows, it sounds like you let the live cd setup the partition, which probably fucked it up… you should follow the dual boot tut on this website…

Read full topic
